amendment.description: An amendment numbered 9 printed in Part B of House Report 116-502 to expand the allowable uses of implementation grants to include creating or improving a one-stop enrollment process for students with multiple public school options, including making school information and data more accessible and easier to understand.
amendment.purpose: Amendment to expand the allowable uses of implementation grants to include creating or improving a one-stop enrollment process for students with multiple public school options, including making school information and data more accessible and easier to understand.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Moulton amendment (A006) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 379 - 34 (Roll no. 188).

action.text: The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A006) pursuant to the rule.
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A006) offered by Mr. Moulton.
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Moulton amendment (A006) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 379 - 34 (Roll no. 188).
Amendment agreed to by House: On agreeing to the Moulton amendment (A006) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 379 - 34 (Roll no. 188).
